basic properties and examples of ring homomorphisms\n[imath] \operatorname{ker}(\varphi) \subset R [/imath] is an ideal.\nIf [imath] J \subset S [/imath] is an ideal, then [imath] \varphi^{-1}(J) \subset R [/imath] is an ideal. [imath] 2 Z [/imath] and [imath] 3 Z [/imath] are isomorphic as groups, but not rings
